title: Religious diversity in Middle East/North Africa in 2010 , by religion
summary: This is a bar chart representing Religion in the x axis and Percentage of population in the y axis.
Religion Muslims has the highest Percentage of population and Unaffiliated has the lowest Percentage of population.
The highest Religion Muslims has 92.0 more Percentage of population than the lowest Religion Unaffiliated.
min_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Religion, and Percentage of population in each Religion on the y axis.
Religion Muslims has the highest Percentage of population and Unaffiliated has the lowest Percentage of population.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Religion in the x axis and Percentage of population in the y axis.
Religion Muslims has the highest Percentage of population and Unaffiliated has the lowest Percentage of population.
The highest Religion Muslims has 92.0 more Percentage of population than the lowest Religion Unaffiliated.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Religion in the x axis and Percentage of population in the y axis.
The Percentage of population is highest at Religion Muslims and lowest at Religion Unaffiliated.
Second maximum Percentage of population is found at Religion Christians.
The highest Religion Muslims has 92.0 more Percentage of population than the lowest Religion Unaffiliated.
Percentage of population at Religion Muslims is 93.0 , second place is Christians at 4.0, and thirdly is Jews at 2.0.
Religion Unaffiliated, and Hindus share the same value 1.0.
The Religion Muslims has 4.6 times more Percentage of population than average.
The Percentage of population is 101.0 if we add up values of all Religions.
